body_html:
Q: What print statement is printing "_wav_data:0 labels_softmax:0 3"?
A: three prints - I added to the code yesterday. pls see my post above, however it is not important anymore

Today I have change the code to print unparsed and I got the following result:

check unparsed= ['\--graph=/tmp/my_frozen_graph.pb', '\--labels=/tmp/speech_commands_train/conv_l
abels.txt', '\--wav=/tmp/speech_dataset/left/a5d485dc_nohash_0.wav']

It means that the parser is wrong in interpreting the backslash in the command line ??

When I deleted the backslash and left only -- then the problem was solved.
Now the command to run the label_wav.py for Windows looks like this:

C:\Users\brm738\tensorflow>python tensorflow/examples/speech_commands/label_wav.py --graph=/tmp/my_frozen_graph.pb --labels=/tmp/speech_commands_train/conv_labels.txt --wav=/tmp/speech_dataset/left/a5d485dc_nohash_0.wav

and I get my testing results as expected:
left (score = 0.87401)
right (score = 0.07143)
unknown (score = 0.03335)

Thank you Derek for your help!
body_text:
Q: What print statement is printing "_wav_data:0 labels_softmax:0 3"?
A: three prints - I added to the code yesterday. pls see my post above, however it is not important anymore
Today I  have change the code  to print unparsed and I got the following result:
check unparsed=  ['\--graph=/tmp/my_frozen_graph.pb', '\--labels=/tmp/speech_commands_train/conv_l
abels.txt', '\--wav=/tmp/speech_dataset/left/a5d485dc_nohash_0.wav']
It means that the parser is wrong in interpreting the backslash in the command line ??

When I deleted the backslash and left only  --  then the problem was solved.
Now the command to run the label_wav.py for Windows looks like this:
C:\Users\brm738\tensorflow>python tensorflow/examples/speech_commands/label_wav.py --graph=/tmp/my_frozen_graph.pb --labels=/tmp/speech_commands_train/conv_labels.txt --wav=/tmp/speech_dataset/left/a5d485dc_nohash_0.wav
and I get my testing results as expected:
left (score = 0.87401)
right (score = 0.07143)
unknown (score = 0.03335)
Thank you Derek for your help!
body:
Q: What print statement is printing "_wav_data:0 labels_softmax:0 3"?
A: three prints - I added to the code yesterday. pls see my post above, however it is not important anymore

Today I  have change the code  to print **unparsed** and I got the following result:

**check unparsed=  ['\\--graph=/tmp/my_frozen_graph.pb', '\\--labels=/tmp/speech_commands_train/conv_l
abels.txt', '\\--wav=/tmp/speech_dataset/left/a5d485dc_nohash_0.wav']**

It means that the parser is wrong in interpreting the backslash in the command line ??

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2536392/33306495-19c01c34-d413-11e7-8b63-420aa0f08035.png)




When I deleted the backslash and left only  **--**  then the problem was solved.
Now the command to run the **label_wav.py** for Windows looks like this:

**C:\Users\brm738\tensorflow>python tensorflow/examples/speech_commands/label_wav.py --graph=/tmp/my_frozen_graph.pb --labels=/tmp/speech_commands_train/conv_labels.txt --wav=/tmp/speech_dataset/left/a5d485dc_nohash_0.wav**

and I get my testing results as expected:
**left (score = 0.87401)
right (score = 0.07143)
_unknown_ (score = 0.03335)**

Thank you Derek for your help!
